data.name: Hypercerts
data.description:
This round aims to strengthen the Hypercerts Ecosystem to realize the vision of an interconnected impact funding network. We specifically want to support projects
1. that integrate hypercerts into existing funding platforms—similar to the hypercerts integration with Gitcoin,
2. that develop new applications like prize competitions leveraging the hypercerts infrastructure,
3. that build tooling to extent the functionality for multiple integrations and applications, such as Deresy to coordinate evaluators, or
4. that are tangible use cases piloting new functionalities, e.g. implementing retroactive funding rounds with hypercerts or using hyperboards.

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Hyperstaker directly strengthens the open-source ecosystem by creating new financial incentives and coordination tools for contributors and funders of OSS projects. It makes it easier for developers and builders to start or sustain public goods work by introducing HyperCert-backed funding cycles that reward meaningful contributions.

Specific contributions include:

🧑‍💻 Supporting OSS Contributors with Predictable Funding

Hyperstaker allows public goods projects to commit to monthly budgets for contributors, backed by HyperCerts. These HyperCerts can be cashed out, traded, or staked, giving OSS builders financial stability without relying on traditional grant cycles.

♻️ Creating Infinite Funding Loops for OSS Projects

Through its staking and retroactive funding mechanisms, Hyperstaker recycles capital and attention back into open-source efforts. Funders receive recognition and future value for supporting impactful projects early, encouraging ongoing participation in the ecosystem.

🧩 Composability with the Web3 OSS Stack

Hyperstaker is designed to integrate with Gitcoin Grants, HyperCerts, Allo Protocol, Optimism RPGF, and more. This modular design expands the coordination layer of OSS funding, helping new tools and projects interoperate seamlessly.

🌍 Enabling Global Participation

By lowering the barriers to entry for both funders and contributors, Hyperstaker enables individuals worldwide—especially from underfunded regions or non-traditional backgrounds—to participate in and benefit from OSS ecosystems.

In essence, Hyperstaker is building the infrastructure for OSS to sustain itself, aligning incentives across contributors, funders, and communities.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Hyperstaker introduces a novel framework for sustainable public goods and OSS funding by combining HyperCerts with programmable funding logic. It enables builders and funders to coordinate around value creation with greater transparency, flexibility, and accountability.

🧰 Key Features:

Monthly HyperCert Funding Cycles

Projects commit to fixed monthly budgets. Contributors receive a HyperCert representing their month of work, which they can redeem, stake, trade, or retire for on-chain reputation or voting rights.

Stakeable Contribution Certificates

Contributors can stake their HyperCerts into a governance contract for future retroactive funding, encouraging long-term alignment rather than immediate extraction.

Funders Receive Financial HyperCerts

Early funders get HyperCerts recognizing their support, which can unlock future upside via governance or retroactive mechanisms, making early support more attractive.

Composability Across Funding Stacks

Hyperstaker plugs into Gitcoin Grants, Allo Protocol, HyperCerts, and other coordination layers—enabling projects to bootstrap funding and evolve toward mature governance.

Multiple Cash-Out Paths

Contributors can choose how to realize value: cash out directly, fractionalize and trade, stake for governance influence, or burn for reputation. This introduces financial agency and flexibility to open-source work.

🔍 Differentiation:

Programmable Public Goods Funding

Most dApps treat funding as a one-time event. Hyperstaker creates recurring, programmable commitment cycles with optionality for both contributors and funders.

Built-In Retroactive Recognition Mechanism

Unlike most dApps where value flows are immediate and linear, Hyperstaker’s staking mechanism aligns with the growing movement for retroactive public goods funding.

OSS-Native Economic Logic

Designed specifically for OSS and public goods—Hyperstaker models value and contributions in a way that traditional grant platforms or DAO tools don't.

Contributor-Centric Design

Instead of building just for fund managers or DAOs, Hyperstaker centers the contributor—providing autonomy, flexibility, and on-chain recognition.

Hyperstaker isn’t just a dApp—it’s an emerging coordination primitive for the future of open-source.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Hyperstaker is in active development, with a working proof of concept underway. The next phase focuses on launching a usable MVP, testing with early public goods projects, and integrating with Gitcoin and HyperCerts ecosystems.

🛠️ Upcoming Development Milestones:

MVP Launch (Q2 2025)

Deploy Hyperstaker on Sepolia for testing

Complete contributor dashboard and funding cycle management UI

Dogfood first active payout of Hyperstaker builders and hypercert staking.

Pilot Programs with Public Goods Projects (Q2–Q3 2025)

Partner with 3–5 OSS/public goods projects for real-world testing

Refine UX for both contributors and funders

Launch Hyperstaker beta with funding cycles running on-chain

💸 Use of Grant Funds:

Product Development & Smart Contract Audits (~50%)

Finalizing core contracts and front-end interface

Funding security reviews and audits before mainnet deployment

Design & UX Research (~20%)

Testing UX assumptions with real contributors and funders

Iterating on the contributor-facing dashboard and staking flows

Ecosystem Partnerships & Pilots (~20%)

Onboarding real OSS projects into early rounds

Creating playbooks for adoption and funder onboarding

Community & Documentation (~10%)

Creating onboarding materials, tutorials, and dev documentation

Hosting early community calls and coordination workshops

Hyperstaker aims to become a core part of the open-source funding stack. This grant will accelerate our ability to test, validate, and scale this novel coordination primitive with real users.
